intro: Collabium balansae, commonly known as the Balansae's collabium, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a glossy, dark green surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Collabium balansae is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
